Authors:
Caixia Wang , Wei ZHANG, Mei Liu, Yong Wang, Jiye Yan,
XingHong Li, Yanmin Wei
Title:
A new pathogen, Cladosporium hebeiense sp. nov. from grape
leaves in China
Keywords:
Cladosporium hebeiense; grape leaf spot; new species;
phylogeny; taxonomy
Abstract:
Grape leaf spot is a common disease that is important for
grape production losses worldwide. A new species, Cladosporium hebeiense
was isolated belonging to the genus Cladosporium from leaf spots of
Vitis vinifera in China. Morphologically distinct C. hebeiense consists
of erect, flexuous, distinctly geniculate, subcylindrical conidiophores;
pale green-brown, smooth, thick-walled conidia with protuberant and
darkened conidial hila; and aseptate, obovoidal to short ellipsoidal,
small terminal conidia. A multigene phylogenetic analysis based on the
internal transcribed spacer region, partial translation elongation
factor 1-alpha gene and the actin gene shown C. hebeiense as a new
species, different from C. ramotenellum. This study provides
morphological and molecular biological studies of the new species.
